core

Class Scene

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Scene

  • public class Scene
extends java.lang.Object
    Scene contains all the GameObjects, meshes, splines, the camera, the directional light and other custom lists.

    • Method Detail

      • addComponentListClass

        public static void addComponentListClass(@NotNull
                                         java.lang.Class key)
        Adds the given key to the Scene's custom lists. After calling this method, all Components that instances the given class, you add to a GameObject will be presented in the Scene's corresponding list.
        Parameters:
        key - class

      • removeComponentListClass

        public static void removeComponentListClass(@NotNull
                                            java.lang.Class key)
        Removes the given key and the correspondig list from the Scene's custom lists. After calling this method, Components that instances the given class, you add to a GameObject no more will be presented in the Scene's corresponding list.
        Parameters:
        key - class

      • getComponentListClasses

        @NotNull
public static java.lang.Class[] getComponentListClasses()
        Returns the keys of the Scene's custom lists.
        Returns:
        the keys of the Scene's custom lists

      • addComponentToLists

        static void addComponentToLists(@NotNull
                                Component component)
        Adds the given Component to the Scene's corresponding lists if it's the instance of the list's class. Note that if the given Component is instace of n list's class, it'll be presented in and only in these lists. You can add more keys by calling the addComponentListClass method but Components added to GameObjects in the past won't be presented in the new lists.
        Parameters:
        component - Component

      • removeComponentFromLists

        static void removeComponentFromLists(@NotNull
                                     Component component)
        Removes the given Component from the Scene's custom lists.
        Parameters:
        component - Component

      • getListOfComponents

        @NotNull
 @ReadOnly
public static <T> java.util.List<T> getListOfComponents(@NotNull
                                                                              java.lang.Class<T> key)
        Returns the list of all the Components which are the given class's instances.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type
        Parameters:
        key - class
        Returns:
        the list of all the Components which are the given class's instances

        public static int getNumberOfGameObjects()

        Returns:
        the number of the GameObjects

      • addGameObject

        static boolean addGameObject(@NotNull
                             GameObject gameObject)
        Adds the specified GameObject to the list of GameObjects. It doesn't add already stored GameObject to the list.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - GameObject
        Returns:
        true if the GameObject added successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - gameObject can't be null

      • getGameObject

        @NotNull
public static GameObject getGameObject(int i)
        Returns the specified GameObject.
        Parameters:
        i - index
        Returns:
        GameObject

      • addMeshComponent

        public static void addMeshComponent(@NotNull
                                    MeshComponent meshComponent)
        Adds the given MeshComponent to the Scene. It is only poossible to add it if it's connected to a GameObject. There is really no reason to call this method, MeshComponents automatically added to the Scene when they connected to a GameObject and removed when disconnected from a GameObject.
        Parameters:
        meshComponent - MeshComponent

      • removeMeshComponent

        public static void removeMeshComponent(@NotNull
                                       MeshComponent meshComponent)
        Removes the given MeshComponent from the Scene. It is only poossible to remove it if it's not connected to a GameObject. There is really no reason to call this method, MeshComponents automatically added to the Scene when they connected to a GameObject and removed when disconnected from a GameObject.
        Parameters:
        meshComponent - MeshComponent

      • getMeshes

        @NotNull
 @ReadOnly
public static Mesh[] getMeshes(@NotNull
                                                     java.lang.Class<? extends Renderer> renderer)
        Returns the array of Meshes using the specified Renderer.
        Parameters:
        renderer - Renderer
        Returns:
        the array of Meshes using the specified Renderer

      • addSplineComponent

        public static void addSplineComponent(@NotNull
                                      SplineComponent splineComponent)
        Adds the given SplineComponent to the Scene. It is only poossible to add it if it's connected to a GameObject. There is really no reason to call this method, SplineComponents automatically added to the Scene when they connected to a GameObject and removed when disconnected from a GameObject.
        Parameters:
        splineComponent - SplineComponent

      • removeSplineComponent

        public static void removeSplineComponent(@NotNull
                                         SplineComponent splineComponent)
        Removes the given SplineComponent from the Scene. It is only poossible to remove it if it's not connected to a GameObject. There is really no reason to call this method, SplineComponents automatically added to the Scene when they connected to a GameObject and removed when disconnected from a GameObject.
        Parameters:
        splineComponent - SplineComponent

      • setEnvironmentColor

        public static void setEnvironmentColor(@NotNull
                                       org.joml.Vector3f environmentColor)
        Sets the environment color to the given value. All of environtment color's components must be min. 0.
        Parameters:
        environmentColor - environment color
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - environtment color can't be lower than 0
